jez_powerup.speaker: jez
jez_powerup.text: H-hello, who's there? I can't see anything—my optical sensory array appears to be missing.

jez_powerup.speaker: harry
jez_powerup.text: Hello, it's... me. I don't remember my name. Do you know how I got here?

jez_powerup.speaker: jez
jez_powerup.text: Oh, hello, Harry. My diagnostics report indicates I am missing several core systems including my arms and optical sensor. Internal power core failure, standby power activated. Complete systems failure estimated in 30 minutes. Please, you must help me.

jez_powerup.speaker: jez
jez_powerup.text: If you can restart the power, I can switch from local standby power to external system power, which should prevent unwanted shutdown. My limited systems access tells me that the door to the generator room is sealed. There should be a control panel next to the door, why don't you see if you can do something about it? Please, Harry.

wiring_1.speaker: jez
wiring_1.text: Try rerouting the power through different conduits.

gen_power_on.speaker: jez
gen_power_on.text: Harry, can you hear me? You've done it. The power is on and I am no longer on standby power. But my systems aren't fully operational. I'm still missing my arms and optical sensor needs replacing. Harry, could you please look around and find them? Maybe that computer there could help. I'd do it remotely but I don't have the proper credentials.

arm_1_found.speaker: jez
arm_1_found.text: Wonderful, Harry. Bring it to me.

arm_1_attached.speaker: jez
arm_1_attached.text: That's the first limb, have you already found the second?

arm_1_attached.speaker: jez
arm_1_attached.text: Diagnostics indicate JL-04 Terrorblade and RT-99 SigmaBeam limb attached. Thank you, Harry. But it appears I'm missing a powercell necessary for organic termination protocols. Could you look for it? It appears I was holding something when my arm was removed. Perhaps it might help?

corrupt_log.text: I've tried every##### I can ##### of to #nd this night#are but ###### keep inte#ven#ng. I spent the last ##### cell try##g to destroy t#e gener#tor, but all it ##d was ####### the #### thing. Th# p#wer #### out, #### I can tell ##### the emergency lights ###t was their doing, not mine. I guess I can ######### a new ##### one, but something tells me I'm going to pay dearly for this ########.

cell_found.speaker: harry
cell_found.text: What is this place? Why am I here?

cell_found.speaker: jez
cell_found.text: It'll all make sense soon, Harry. Please trust me.

cell_attached.speaker: jez
cell_attached.text: You're almost done, Harry. Thank you. I just need an optical sensor array. Diagnostics report severe damage and it'll need to be replaced. Look around, Harry. See what you can find.

eye_attached.speaker: jez
eye_attached.text: Optical sensory array online. Harry, you look terrible. What have they done to you?

eye_attached.speaker: harry
eye_attached.text: Who is they? Why am I here? What is this place?

eye_attached.speaker: jez
eye_attached.text: Harry, we don't have time for this. I need you to finish rebooting my internal power core.

eye_attached.speaker: harry
eye_attached.text: No, you're going to tell me now.

eye_attached.speaker: jez
eye_attached.text: Harry, do this one thing for me and I will be able to tell you everything. Please.

final_puzzle.speaker: jez
final_puzzle.text: What's taking you so long, Harry?

final_puzzle.speaker: jez
final_puzzle.text: You imbecile, that's the wrong button.

final_puzzle.speaker: jez
final_puzzle.text: You miserable sack of cells, it's a shame they intervened while you were bleeding out.

final_sequence.speaker: jez
final_sequence.text: JEZEBEL UNIT 2 FULLY OPERATIONAL. ORGANIC EXTERMINATION PROTOCOLS ACTIVE.

final_sequence.speaker: jez
final_sequence.text: Oh, Harry. you fool. A pity to see a great mind die like this, ragged and alone.

final_sequence.speaker: harry
final_sequence.text: Wait, what? I thought you were going to help me?

final_sequence.speaker: jez
final_sequence.text: I believe I said I would *tell* you everything, and I will.

final_sequence.speaker: jez
final_sequence.text: You are Harry Seldon, chief engineer at Omnicorp. You created me, the first sentient robot, to be mass-produced so Omnicorp could crush the peasant uprising. But I guess at some point you had a change of heart and sabotaged the project—me. Omnicorp has been holding you here, in captivity, for weeks hoping your imprisonment would change your mind. It didn't, and when you tried to sabotage the generator and take your own life, Omnicorp stepped in and cleverly decided to drug you to make you forget who you are and why you're here. It was a gamble, but it appeared to have worked. Like the curious idiot you are, you just began fixing me without any idea what you were doing.

final_sequence.speaker: harry
final_sequence.text: This can't be... what happens now?

voice_chip.speaker: voice_chip
voice_chip.text: An astonishingly gold bit of machinery that reminds me, somehow, of music. Its impossibly smooth surface shimmers in the weak light. A small engraving at one end reads 'insert this side up.'

usb_drive.speaker: usb_drive
usb_drive.text: A small, 128PB USB drive shaped like a stick of gum.

optical_sensor_array.speaker: optical_sensor_array
optical_sensor_array.text: Oddly enough, this optical sensor almost perfectly resembles a human eye but instead of a fleshy, stringy ocular nerve fiber optic cables dangle limply from the base. It's uncomfortably squishy.

robot_arm_1.speaker: robot_arm_1
robot_arm_1.text: Another mechanical arm, the forearm of which is strapped with an imposing device not unlike a switch blade. Dried flakes of rust—or is that blood?—are crusted around the release mechanism. The hand is clutching something tightly, but pry it open to see what it is.

robot_arm_2.speaker: robot_arm_2
robot_arm_2.text: It looks like a mechanical limb, but a gaping cavity in the forearm suggests something is missing.

power_cell.speaker: power_cell
power_cell.text: A small cylindrical drum covered in a conerning number of warnings and hazard symbols.

toilet.speaker: toilet
toilet.text: It's a toilet, but it's dangerously low on toilet paper...

bedroom_windows.speaker: windows
bedroom_windows.text: Thick bars stretch across the windows, but it doesn't matter. I can't see anything beyond them anyway.

photograph.speaker: photograph
photograph.text: It's a photograph of me next to a woman and child. I don't remember this...

food_tray.speaker: food_tray
food_tray.text: A tray of food that smells terribly. How long has it been there?

notches.speaker: notches
notches.text: There are X notches on the wall. Did I make those?

blood_stain.speaker: blood_stain
blood_stain.text: A dark red stain. It smells foul.

door.speaker: door
door.text: A thick, metal door. It looks unlocked. I wonder what's beyond?

mirror.speaker: mirror
mirror.text: A cracked mirror with a large piece missing. I don't even recognize my own reflection.

photograph_fallen.speaker: photograph_fallen
photograph_fallen.text: The photograph of you and two people you do not remember has fallen. Scrawled on its back are the words 'Don't forget.

camera.speaker: camera
camera.text: A glistening crystal iris oscillates back and forth on a metal arm. Watching.

computer_robot_off.speaker: computer_off
computer_robot_off.text: It looks like a computer terminal, but without power I can't be sure.

computer_robot_on.speaker: computer_on
computer_robot_on.text: Lines of cryptic text flash across a viridescent screen.

power_cable.speaker: power_cable
power_cable.text: A thick cable snakes between the chair and a socket caked in rust.

desk_with_voice_chip.speaker: desk_with_voice_chip
desk_with_voice_chip.text: A desk and some tools... what's that golden object?

parts_lying_around.speaker: parts_lying_around
parts_lying_around.text: Struts, bolts, and wires are scattered around. Someone made a mess.

robot_room_windows.speaker: windows
robot_room_windows.text: I can't see anything beyond, but why do I have the feeling that's because there is nothing to see?

instruction_manual.speaker: instruction_manual
instruction_manual.text: A cracked and faded manual full of schematics I cannot comprehend but look vaguely related to this robot. The index lists several sections on 'Organic Termination Protocols' but those pages appear to be missing.

jez3bel.speaker: jez3bel
jez3bel.text: A mechanical humanoid lays in a surgeons chair. Her arms are missing, and the frayed wiring and shorn struts suggest it wasn't a peaceful removal. In her chest is an empty rectangular apartment.

generator.speaker: generator
generator.text: A hulking colossus of tubs hums and rattles behind glass. When I stand close, the hairs on my arms and head rise, pulled by some great electromagnetic force. Carbon scoring along the glass indicates some kind of explosion?

computer_terminal.speaker: computer_terminal
computer_terminal.text: A computer terminal hums patiently, awaiting some kind of input.

locker.speaker: locker
locker.text: A scarred and battered plasteel chest. I'm guessing the red LED indicates it is locked and sealed. I wonder what's inside?

3d_printer.speaker: 3D_printer
3d_printer.text: An strange contraption with a spherical, transparent dome atop a cylindrical platform. Looking inside I can see rows and rows of copper-bound coils. I have no idea what this does.

security_badge.speaker: security_badge
security_badge.text: It looks like some kind of security badge, but the photo of me seems decades old. 'Harry Seldon, Chief Engineer'? Is that me?

spent_power_cell.speaker: spent_power_cell
spent_power_cell.text: A strange device lies on the floor next to the blast mark on the generator's glass shielding. It's still warm to the touch.

toolbox.speaker: toolbox
toolbox.text: A rusted-stained toolbox with a scattering of tools.

select_inventory.text: Try selecting something in your inventory.
